title: Ritvik Sharma on Building a Global Luxury Brand

content.text: In this exclusive interview, Ritvik Sharma, founder and creative director of Velvét, shares the journey of transforming a fledgling idea into a powerhouse of modern luxury. From late nights sketching designs in a small studio to commanding the runways of Milan and Paris, Sharma’s story is one of grit, vision, and unrelenting passion.
From Modest Beginnings to Milan Runways

Velvét’s rise to international acclaim was anything but overnight. 'We started with a handful of artisans and a dream to put craftsmanship back at the heart of luxury,' Sharma recalls. His early passion for timeless tailoring combined with a desire to push fabric innovation became the dual engine driving Velvét’s ascent.

Today, Velvét collections are not only featured at Milan Fashion Week but also stocked in flagship stores across London, Dubai, and Tokyo — a testament to Sharma’s global vision and the universal appeal of the brand’s refined aesthetic.

Like many great ventures, Velvét faced its fair share of challenges in the early days. Supply chain disruptions, skepticism from industry gatekeepers, and the struggle to fund artisanal production were daily battles. 'Resilience was everything,' Sharma says. 'We had to stay firm in our belief that there was space for a brand that combined heritage craft with modern performance.'
Sharma credits this perseverance — along with a small but dedicated team — for weathering the storms and laying the groundwork for future success.

'Luxury today is about more than status — it’s about meaning, authenticity, and innovation,' Sharma explains. For Velvét, this translates to using eco-conscious materials, collaborating with artisan communities, and introducing proprietary fabric technologies that enhance comfort without sacrificing elegance.

This forward-thinking vision has made Velvét a favorite among discerning global clients, from celebrities walking red carpets to executives looking for wardrobe staples that embody quiet sophistication.

Sharma's 'uncompromising eye for detail' is legendary within the brand. Every jacket, dress, and coat undergoes multiple rounds of refinement before reaching the customer. From hand-finished seams to custom-dyed linings, no element is too small to escape scrutiny. 'Luxury is built in the details that most people will never even notice — but they feel it,' he says.
It’s this dedication that has earned Velvét not just commercial success, but critical acclaim from fashion insiders in Milan, Paris, and beyond.

As Velvét continues to grow its global footprint, Sharma remains grounded in his founding principles. Plans are already underway to expand into home textiles and lifestyle products, bringing the brand’s signature blend of craft and innovation into new arenas.

'Building a brand is never finished,' Sharma reflects. 'It’s a living, breathing thing that evolves with the times — but the soul must always stay intact.' And with Velvét, that soul remains stronger than ever.
